title:  These funds are available for expenditure or encumbrance through the 2025–26 fiscal year

 LEAs with 2020‐21 Grades 9‐12 Unduplicated Pupil Counts that received concentration grant funding as of the second principal apportionment certification for the 2020‐21 fiscal year are eligible to receive the A–G Completion Grant

$300 Million to LEAs with 2020‐21 A–G completion rates less than 67% based on the number of unduplicated pupils enrolled in grades 9‐12 (2020‐21 CALPADS Fall 1). Eligible LEAs will receive a minimum allocation of $75,000

note: o Allocations for COEs will be available in October 2021.
title: o For standardized account code structure, use Resource Code 7430, Other Restricted State, and Revenue Object Code 8590, All Other State Revenue

o Apportionment: COEs can expect to receive 100 percent of their allocation in November 2021. o Questions about allocations and apportionments for the COVID‐19 Mitigation for Counties can be sent to the Categorical Allocations and Audit Resolutions Office by email at CAAR@cde.ca.gov

CDE o Unaudited actuals data submissions due to CDE October 15. o SACS web system user outreach sessions October 7 (1‐3pm) and October 12 (10am – noon) for COEs (requires pre‐registrations); CDE will forward to ESSCO to share registration link. o Special Education Funding ‐Resource code 6536 and Special Education Learning Recovery Support funds & Resource code 6537 can use pass‐thru for county office fund 10 or Object 8590

Standing Subcommittee Reports 1. AB 1200, Kathryn Rusk ‐ None 2. Accounting, Tom Cassida – emailed 15% increase for concentration grant calculation spreadsheet, please contact Tom if you have additional questions
